title: Viktor or maokai?
body:
Want both, almost got enough for one... They both look so fun too me, and I've always been a fan of underplayed champs (yorick, Taric etc...) 

So which ones...
More stronger
More better mid/later game
Better for team fights
Has a higher win rate in lane/jg and game winning rate...
More CC
More fun

Thanks!

replies.body: I guess Viktor has won! The only thing that is bothering me about him is landing his e. I heard its exactly like rumbles ult, and in my case, a hard landing skill... When I'm under pressure I just smash keys like not tommorow (not really, but I don't take to time to land a specific skill with that certain technique) and I will feel if I don't land it I'll be screwed... Anyone get what I'm saying?

Legit,

Viktor's really fun and doesn't get boring to play, but requires a lot of practise.
Maokai isn't that fun and gets repetitive to play, but is easier to succeed with.


Also, Maokai's passive has been nerfed this patch.

Depends what you mean by stronger. A fed Viktor has enough damage to instakill someone very easily with a E+Q+R. A fed Maokai is a tank and can be almost unkillable.
Again, define better.
Both are equally good teamfighters for different reasons. Mao's ult reduces the damage taken for his whole team, he also has good peel and lockdown. Viktor's ult is AOE and his stun/slow is AOE, his E can be AOE so played properly he can destroy a teamfight.

Viktor has a 48% winrate, Maokai has a 49% winrate.

Maokai does. His Q is a knockback, W is a root and E is a slow.

Depends what you like playing.

Personally I prefer Mao because I don't like playing mages that much. I like tankier champions.

> [{quoted}](name=BarryButcher,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=R35aHRNM,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-04-07T23:59:43.714+0000)
>
> Depends what you mean by stronger. A fed Viktor has enough damage to instakill someone very easily with a E+Q+R. A fed Maokai is a tank and can be almost unkillable.
> Again, define better.
> Both are equally good teamfighters for different reasons. Mao's ult reduces the damage taken for his whole team, he also has good peel and lockdown. Viktor's ult is AOE and his stun/slow is AOE, his E can be AOE so played properly he can destroy a teamfight.
> 
> Viktor has a 48% winrate, Maokai has a 49% winrate.
> 
> Maokai does. His Q is a knockback, W is a root and E is a slow.
> 
> Depends what you like playing.
> 
> Personally I prefer Mao because I don't like playing mages that much. I like tankier champions.

I think going with Mao is better as well. He can Top effectively and Jungle with ease, while viktor can only mid.
